body.p: The undersigned, having been appointed by the Governor, under the 5th Section of Article 2 Chapter 101 Revised Statues, to state the accounts of James H. Garrard late Treasurer of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, with the commonwealth, to ascertain the amount of public funds on hand; to make a true and perfect inventory thereof and take the receipt of the newly appointed Treasurer, M. P. Brown Esq. beg leave to make their Statement and report as follows towit:
Jame H. Garrard late Treasurer died on Sunday the 13th of August 1865: Saturday the 12th was his last official day of business.
On the 12th of August 1865, at the close of the business of that day, we find James H. Garrard Treasurer of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, chargable with the following sums of money, viz;

Revenue Department $207.952-98
Sinking Fund Proper 273.898-72
School Fund Proper 76.429-76
Making a total of -- $558.281-46
(say five hundred and fifty eight thousand two hundred and eighty one dollars and forty six cents)

In ascertaining the amount of public funds on hand, we examined the Branch Bank of Kentucky at Frankfort, where the Treasurer
keeps his deposits of the public funds, and also we examined the Treaurers safe in his office -- We found no funds in the safe. We found standing to the credit of James H. Garrard Treasurer of the Comth of Kentucky on the books of said Branch Bank the sums of $565.834-04

And we found upon examination of the Treasurers Bank Book that he had previous to the close of the 12th of August 1865, drawn and delivered checks upon the funds in Said Branch Bank which are still outstanding, not paid to the amount of 7.552-58
A list of which unpaid checks we have caused to be made and here with present as part of this report.
Leaving as will be seen, the same amount with which we find the late Treasurer chargeable, to be transferred to the incoming Treasurer viz= $558.281.46

Which transfer has been made and we herewith report the receipt of the newly appointed Treasurer therefor. Which will leave in deposit as aforesaid said sum of= $7.552.58
to the credit of James H Garrard Is to much said outstanding checks.

All which is respectfully submitted
A. J. James
Frankfort. August 18th 1865= Jas A. Dawson
Report of the Special Commissions appld by the Governor to examine the affairs of James Garrard decd late Treasurer of the State of Ky.
